Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2007 01:36PM ducky1 wrote: Cynthia, like you, I thought I WAS doing the right things...exercising, trying to keep weight at a decent level, drinking moderately (most of the time..) then whamo!! right between the eyes... I can understand becoming a vegetarian but I would just simply starve as I like my meat too much. I am making little changes like adding Flaxseed in the hopes that it will ward off the beast. I've given myself 2 months to get my act together in all ways before I return to work. Thank you all for sharing as it sure made me feel better!! that I am not totally losing my mind!!
Posts.Title: Anyone anxious at end of rads treatment? Stressin67 arnica

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2007 04:33PM ducky1 wrote: OMG...you have said everything that I feel.. there is a HUGE knot of anxiety in my chest and I haven<t even done rads yet. I have gone to work 2X just to visit and broke down both times... I consider myself a  strong person but this is reducing me to pulp... WTH? Scared... like nothing I have ever experienced. One of the gals on our cruise went from stage 2 to 4 so that really hits below the belt...after chemo and rads., you sure as hell don<t expect that diagnosis.. it could be ME! Shirlann...you are right on the mark! I sure feel that way but no one except a fellow survivor knows what I am going through! I pray that things WILL get better but am afraid... Cath

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2007 04:34PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; Don't let the posts scare you...everyone reacts differently just like not one of us has exactly the same type of cancer. Reactions depend on which "cocktail" they give you... how many...to be honest, the anti-nausea meds helped a great deal...I never felt great the first wk after tx but not to the pt. where it was debilitating. I was able to keep up with every day chores, the house, etc.. I did not work as I am a teacher and my immune system was compromised. Seeing as I am in Canada, I didn't have access to Neulasta or Neupogen so the time between txs was 4 wks instead of 3! Hair came out 2 wks. after first tx. Oh, I had 6 chemos and if I were to do it again, I would have a port or picc line as one of the meds. totally killed my veins!! Infusion of my 3 meds. was 2 1/2 hrs. and I always brought a friend along to keep me company. Ask away, Barb :) All in all, it is doable...I feel that since I survived this, I can definitely survive anything!! I don't know if you are religious but I prayed for courage before each tx. and He never failed me.  :) Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2007 07:40PM ducky1 wrote: OMG Barb; That is SO GREAT that you are having the surgery. I know it changes >plans> but sometimes you have to go with the flow... CARPE DIUM, right??? Getting that out of your body is a priority! No chemo!!!! I was thinking about you today and wondering... many times during tx I said to heck with this, I am LIVING and ate WHAT I wanted and DRANK what I wanted WOOHOO!! Hopefully Rita will call soon and if not, you just call... cause sometimes, for whatever reason, we get lost in the shuffle!! Enjoy the wkd. Love Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2008 09:34PM ducky1 wrote: Hey Barb; I can relate to thinking it might be your last night on earth... I never consciously believed it but in the back of my mind, that doubt was there. Cookies, however, were not my choice; I was going to have some red wine :) and I did...sometimes lots! I realize now that it was my way of dulling the pain if only temporarily...to me, cancer and tx cause the greatest damage to your inner well being... not your body although it does go through a lot. Barb, I asked my doc for a copy of my path report then asked questions. You have a right to the document so call girl! Docs are not always forcoming. It will tell you your ER-PR status as well as Her2. My onc. is the one who told me what stage and grade I was at, not the surgeon. Did it hurt when they removed the drains? My mom said that it did for her. Like Shirlann, I sailed through rads. and made a true connection with my techs who were fantastic. When you see someone every day, you develop a rapport. Ok, funny story from school... I was reviewing what the kids should do as they walk down the hall (grade 1) on Monday...one says " don't talk", the other "hands behind your back" and the last "breathe!!!" He said it in all sincerity... what a hoot!! Then Tuesday one gets his finger stuck in a bookshelf...OMG!! Love 'em! :) Cathy
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2008 06:45PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; In Canada, Neulasta is an option rather than a tx... expensive at that...$2,700 a pop here. So I did not have the shot and that is why my white blood count went down. Yours will be fine with the shot so don't worry. XX Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2008 09:36PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; You sound good!! and Eugene must just be a cutie patootie!! You may be very lucky and have very few side effects. One of the gals that I met here got through almost unscathed:) I think what I hated most about chemo was drinking all that dang water (I am not a water drinker....more like a camel). But like you, I wanted to flush all that crap out of my body. Tried crystal light and most anything you can think of. Too bad I never felt like having wine when I was in tx The fear of the first tx is over!!! How many more do you have?? Sabrina, how many txs do you have to have in all?? Break a leg tomorrow! :) Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2007 10:50PM ducky1 wrote: Yahoo!!! Great news Barbara... Now you can move forward... what good news...sigh!!! This was good news that I needed to hear Sleep well!! Hugs, Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2007 03:57PM ducky1 wrote: Hi Barb The sun is shining here so I am sending it your way!! Not like you need it or anything...hee hee!! There are gals on this site very knowledgeable about masec. who can answer your questions but here go a few... I was part of a program at a hospital called Healing Connections which was great. They had us meet every 2 wks. 3x and discussed eating, problems, lymphedema..you name it, we asked!! They also had physio sessions for all of us; the gals who had masectomies usually had less range of motion so gentle stretches are essential...only as far as you can go..no pushing! You should inquire and see if anything similar is available. If not, this might be something to pursue once you are totally over this journey. Ours is totally put on by volunteers who have been through BC. There is also a nurse employed by hospital for medical questions and ladies who bring in specialty camisoles, bras, prosthesis', etc... so you can browse in comfort without feeling self-conscious. If I were retired, I would become involved. I had a lump. followed by chemo then radiation for 6 wks. which is pretty standard so I got to know the techs. pretty well. They were terrific! Then again, I felt a great need to connect with them and not be just another face. I wanted them to recognize me without me having to flash "me boob!!" and they did! I'll check in again before we go away Sat. Hugs, Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2008 11:39PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; The one piece of advice that I would give those just starting is that there IS light at the end of the tunnel and that you will get through tx... and to hang on to that light with a positive attitude (which you have!!!) I can hardly believe that my "anniversary" is coming up. Feb. 6th, 2007 I had the tumour removed so I have been cancer free for a year :)  You and your hb seem to be well suited for each other!! I hate brussel sprouts too!! I'm sorry that the site where the drains were cause so much pain. My mom had 2 masectomies 5 yrs apart and it was the drains that caused the pain! Have you seen the thread about 'stupid things that people say'?? All those "friends" who share nasty stories about chemo, rads, etc.... are NOT friends. Can I shoot them for you? GRRRRRR!!! OMG... I know what you mean about not being able to go on one side... I am a tried and true 'TUMMY' sleeper and trying to sleep on my side after surgery or back was hell. Barb, I am soo grateful for being alive and in good health. A girlfriend wants to throw me a 50th birthday and I said that I want it to be a celebration of the people who supported me through this journey...not about me! You will reach this pt. too. Please let me know how you are tomorrow! XXCath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 10:51PM ducky1 wrote: Great news, Barb... things have a way of working out! That doc will not confront you...he got my e-mail......just kidding...unfortunately, to some docs, we are just another stat and nothing more. XXX Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2008 10:57PM ducky1 wrote: Sabrina; Are you on AC then Taxol?? Looks like you are in a deep freeze or at least a snowstorm!!! Just like us here! Don't get too excited about the peach fuzz yet... I, too, felt like you but when I pulled on it (not that hard), it came out!! what the %%%%%!!! I was disappointed to say the least! Barb, how are you holding up??? Let us know! I had what I thought was a "routine" mammo only it didn't turn out that way. My appt. was at 1:20 and I didn't leave until 4:00!! They took slides, then wanted more... then took slides of my GOOD BOOB!!! By now, scenes are flashing through my head as I sure as heck didn't expect this! And I see this cute guy going back and forth with x-rays and think "those are mine"! Guess what... THEY WERE!!! Afterwards they tell me I need to have a US! Meanwhile poor hb has been waiting about 1 1/2 hrs.... finally, about 2 hrs. later they tell me it is a cyst. Funny, am I relieved...of course... but not celebrating...it is just too stressful. I guess the lesson to be learned is that it is never totally over.  Hugs!! Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2008 02:26AM ducky1 wrote: Sabrina; Sorry that Taxol is so rough! A few gals on our thread did it and had joint pains, etc... Hope you get #6? done and over with Friday! We don't have tons of snow like you guys but we do have the cold temps!! Barb, don't even call it being lazy as you aren't!! It is called "self-preservation"... you need to take care of yourself and when your body says "I'm tired", then you rest! You don't have a choice!! So what are the names of your drugs? Every 3 wks? or ?? Sent you a PM. Hope you are feeling not too badly. Tomorrow is my anniversary of NED. Barb, is that also the last day of anti- nausea meds? XXCath

Posts.Title: Shave the fuzz off ? trigeek bomber410

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2007 02:01AM ducky1 wrote: Barb; You sound good and positive!!! I am SO glad that you are being wise and holding off the volunteering until you are ready...I want to give to these ladies too.. I think we do just by posting, you know? You are so right about this site... there is no way to explain the support and hope that we receive. I feel that soon I want to start "paying it forward" like the movie.  Panicky... yup, I would have anxiety attacks...what helped was using deep breathing to calm me down (I am taking yoga for the first time and it is not for wussies like I thought). Also, a friend gave me a wonderful smooth stone (I love nature!! to me it is like being right there beside Him) and the word "courage" has been cut into it. I carry it around in my pocket and when I need it, I'll rub it and it  helps. You are going through the toughest period now... at least it was for me... once I knew what I was dealing with, I had a PLAN and could move forward. Now I am making a NEW plan seeing that I am done tx. I hope the time flies by until the 29th. :) Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2007 10:02AM ducky1 wrote: Barb, Am very glad that your appt. is sooner!!! The sooner the better then the "plan of action" takes shape!  ok, surgery...they were really on the ball... when I saw my GP 1 wk after biopsy, she already had an appt. lined up for a surgical consult the following wk. Five DAYS later the mass was removed so it can be really quick depending on your doc as well as how busy the surgeons are!! As for staging, they can give you an educated guess but it is not until they get your path. report after surgery that all is confirmed. It was my onc. who shared the path report with me. Upset...numb...not when they told me that I had cancer...as I somehow knew that I did and could FINALLY move forward. Like you Barb, I was more worried about keeping the house running and "normalcy" for my 13 & 14 yr. old and I did succeed (am now at the other end of the tunnel). Late at night, in the comfort of my ducky's arms, I did break down out of fear that I would not be around for them. I have seen and heard too much this last yr. to take life for granted... Like Erica, I never said "why me?"...it just is, what it is and I dealt with it. I also needed to be strong for my hb. as it was terribly diff. for him; you see, he had cancer himself in 2001.  Looking back over this past yr. since my discovery Jan 13th, I realize how quickly the yr. has gone by.. Jan. I go back to work and try to attain a "new" normal. Let us know the news... :) cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2007 09:49AM ducky1 wrote: Barb, I think docs are just like all of us...some need more stroking than others My internist (he was working under the onc.) did a wee too much talking for what I like rather than listening. My rad. onc., on the other hand, was much better at listening. However, by far the best people that I met, hands down, were the grunts as my DH would call them... the rad. techs! They made this whole journey more palatable as we actually got to know one another (I needed to make a connection with these people as I saw them every day for 6 wks.) Am glad that your swelling is better. Surgery after Christmas sounds good...I know you want it out but like you said, pissing off the surgeon would not go over too well esp. when he has the scalpel.  You can enjoy the day with your family!! :) Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2007 11:35AM ducky1 wrote: Hey Barb; I will check in later today to see how things went with the surgeon. You know, I would never have thought of what you mentioned about having to drive across "the strip". Do they not arrest these guys? Or are they more lenient because it is a "tourist" town? Here in Canada, there is no tolerance for drunk drivers. That is crappy that it's at the other end of town. Are buses an option? a good friend? When I had chemo, I set it up so that I had a diff. person each time that came with me... I don't like to put people out but they felt good about contributing in this small way. I would bet you could count on some people...church members? By the way, if you are a reader, there are some great books out there that really helped me along the way. Let me know and I will pass on the names. :) Hugs my friend!! Cath

We are off to Maui for 2 wks....can<t wait! I turn 50 there as does hubby.. this was planned well before cancer. I believe we were meant to be there at this time. I am hoping that I can let go, even more, of this cancer albatross! Will be thinking of you on the 2nd. Prayers heading your way! In the meantime, go visit the masectomy threads if you haven<t already done so... they will be full of concrete advise for you to get ready (I like to know what I am facing). Have a blessed Christmas!! (I have a mini tree about 6inches tall in my suitcase...hee hee...kids don<t know!!) Love Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2008 03:52PM ducky1 wrote: Barb, Only words of wisdom which you already know is "listen to your body!" and don't overdo it or you pay the price...K? When you spoke of grade 2, do you mean at church or in a school? I was off work for the duration of chemo (low white blood count  makes you very susceptible to anything esp. when around little kiddies) and rads. (very disruptive to the kids). No regrets! Now is the time to take care of yourself and make yourself a priority so you won't have to worry about this blasted disease coming back. I feel like my happiness is on the mend... not that I wasn't a "suck it up" type of gal but the big C always seemed to be looming around. I am feeling more "normal" whatever that may be. I do understand about your hb. saying that he was stressed. Mine was also on pins and needles!!  About the chemo and Neulasta... chemo was fine for the first few days until  I went off the steroids then I felt nauseous for a while... NOT all of us have the same reaction. From what I have read on this site about Neulasta, it can cause a great deal of joint pain BUT not in everyone...so cross that bridge when you get there, K? We go through one hurdle at a time... surgery, OVER...healing, HAPPENING ;) You will fly through this as you have such a positive attitude. I never had the option of Neulasta or Neupogen shots (not in Canada, eh?) It would have cost $2,700 per shot and I needed approval from ins. so just stuck with chemo every 4 wks. rather than 3. Diane, you are wise to ask for a med. to combat pain. Hang in there!! How many txs are you having and what is your "cocktail" of choice?? XCath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2008 03:29PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; You are now officially on the roller coaster ride of your life...you know, the one that NO ONE wants to be on. Don't beat yourself up about a down moment, hr., whatever it may be..."it too shall pass". As I have said before, when things were at their worst (in my eyes, at least), I prayed for Him to share the burden or just please take it away and it always helped. All these ladies here are going to continue to be here for you!! Diane is so totally right about the Muga scan. One of my yummy cocktails has side effects on the heart. My heart was pretty dang strong but the chemo would leave me breathless going up and down stairs so be careful. I can't believe they didn't ask why? Being overworked is just not an acceptable excuse. At least you liked your surgeon as did I; what a compassionate man! Big hugs coming your way!! XCath PS.. if you want to trade cities, I would be very happy. Today we have a balmy -45C... colder than Iqualuit...geez Louise!
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2008 10:55AM ducky1 wrote: Diana, it makes me cry just to think of how you are feeling. Chemo sucks...I always wanted one of those T-shirts but never got one (though I did find the site). How many txs are you having??? Hang in there girls!! I cannot believe that Feb. 7th was my 1 yr. anniversary of having cancer cut out of my body. The yr. went by slowly when I felt bad yet quickly...hard to describe. You soon will be where I am and Shirlann is. I met NED (No Evidence of Disease) on Tuesday and was ecstatic. XXCath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2008 11:23AM ducky1 wrote: Morning ladies; Sabrina, it sounds like you are having a rough go at getting back on your feet after chemo. One of my gals ended up having lymphedema in her breast so she went to physio; push for it. I know we get so tired of fighting; at least I did. Barb, why in the heck do they have you on Tamoxifen now?? That would be my first question... OMG...I have never heard of taking it DURING chemo. Normally the gals start taking it AFTER chemo but during rads is ok. I had enough SE<s from chemo let alone Tamoxifen. The chemo put me into menopause and the Tamx. increased the hot flashes. Then not having test results in the chart or explaining is just not acceptable. Please talk to your primary and onc!! Well, the weather here has finally been ok... only -8C today. Last night we went skiing at a local hill nearby (some parents in my school subsidize a ski night through their place of work). I felt so alive... you guys will too and then it will be a memory (oh yeah, I remember when....) I am not a good skier but we had a blast. take care guys X cath

I think my cancer tx will help him with his.Also, are you automatically stage 4 if you have mets? Thanks

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2007 01:34AM ducky1 wrote: Barb, Unfortunately, I am not surprised at how powerful the brain is... when I am really upset about something, I have a hard time getting to sleep as my brain keeps going over and over the same thing (hmmm... I am sure a cancer dx fell into this category LOL). When I was where you are, I would be up until real late speaking to gals in the chat room and crying (I needed to let it out as it was eating me up). You do what you have to do right now to get through this... whether it is taking pills to allieve the anxiety, exercise (but I didn't start yoga until after most of this was over...should have done it sooner)... whatever!! I also learned that I had to give up "control" during these past 9 months as it was in HIS hands... what's that saying.."change things you can and the wisdom to know the diff.??"  So I really did try... this is not easy for a "control freak" like me!! Do you work? That keeps your mind occupied too.. kids?? Have to get a turkey ready... no, not hb or me... a real one!! Company's coming!!! Hugs to you, CAth
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2007 10:21AM ducky1 wrote: Hey Barb; As I said, ask away Barb, I learned lots of this from the site but I also did lots of reading both on the net and books. If you want to go this route, let me know and I<ll recommend some of my faves. Many gals seem to have read Susan Love<s book about bc but when I looked through it, it wasn<t what I was looking for. When you meet with your onc., they usually go over your path report (after surgery) but since you are doing chemo first, that most likely won<t happen. Has your doc told you what stage? grade? of cancer that you have? Your age, whether you are in menopause or not, family history, etc... all factor in when they are giving you chemo options. Because I was pre-meno. and that my cancer was moving towards the lymph system, a certain chemo was recommended and I felt confident with their recommendations. My lump was 2.1 so I opted for a lumpectomy and am happy with the results. Remember, you make the decision...it is always your choice!! One of my chemos (Epirubicin) pretty much collapsed whatever vein they were using. The good news is that other veins take over from the other one. My last tx I asked for a picc line (google it and port on this site and it will give you a picture and more accurate explanation than I can) Chemo was so easy with the line as the nurses did not have to poke around for a vein that would work (I offered my bum that they were not too thrilled with that... go figure!!!) Hair... mine starting growing back within a few wks. after chemo was over. Weight...I lost 6lbs each first wk. of tx as nothing was appealing. However, I gained it back once I felt somewhat >normal>. I walked throughout tx. Some people gain (steroids and stress) while others lose...again, it varies like which chemo they recommend or how you react. You shouldn<t need any special skin creams for chemo...apart from a good moisturizer as my skin dried and cracked (hands). Once you meet with your onc. and have a start date, join one of the chemo cruises. Unfortunately, there is a new thread each month with lots of ladies who will support you... and I will be here Bottom line is that yup, I am ok!! I am going back to work part-time in Jan. and looking forward to finding a New NORMAL as the journey changes us. Take care Xcath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2007 03:48PM ducky1 wrote: Veroland; Scroll down in Community K. Exchange and you will find a thread for young women exactly like yourself who are going through this disease. You will be able to find someone who can relate to your situation.Sorry you have joined this club. Hang in there! Cathy
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2007 10:22PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; You<re too funny...ME charging!! No chance of that happening... None of us want this dreaded disease... I hate it! I hope I didn<t scare you too much. That was not my intention. I believe that knowledge is power .. the teacher in me!! You, my dear friend, are in menopause. When you don<t have that monthly visit for a full year, you<re in a new stage. I was still having my periods and NO FLASHES!!! Now I have been launched into CHEMOpause.. and Tamoxifen just enhances those suckers.. thank you very much. They will also look at whether you are Estrogen/ Progesterone + or- as tx varies according to that as well. I am taking Tamx. as my tumour was fed by Estrogen and the pill blocks the release in my body. It is totally natural to be concerned about every ache and pain!! Take a deep breath...you know it has not spread Where do you live?? desert... I<m in the tundra!! -18C At one pt., during tx, I was worried that my slight cold would put off tx but it didn<t. You would have to be pretty comprised, I would guess, for them to cancel the surgery. You have a good plan in place so stick with it!! As for the people who are AGHAST, they know nothing... ABSOLUTELY nothing... they have not walked in our shoes.  I am not a holistic type gal; I am not willing to take any chances of NOT being around. I want to see grandkids one day (not yet as my kids are only 13 &14!! PLEASE!!!) Here is what my onc. told me... without tx (surgery, chemo, rads) my chance of recc. was 50%...however, with tx it went down to 15%. Would they not do the same as us? Arrrg.... Tomorrow I am meeting a gal that lives here in Edmonton for breakfast. We met through this site and have kept in touch via e-mails...we even met once to play golf. It is so great speaking to someone who understands... no one else really does! Hang in there, my friend!! Hugs, Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2008 06:36PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; It seems to me that there are ways of getting those pills paid for even if you are not covered... is there not medical aid?? I am not familiar with the US system. My pills are FREE and covered by the government. I just go to the cancer hospital and get my meds. $350 is a lot but worth your piece of mind. I am going to put up with these darn hot flashes (caused by meds). Someone should be able to point you in the right direction re: ways to get the pills if you aren<t covered. I am trying to make lifestyle changes partly due to this cancer scare but mainly because I am not happy with my present weight. I have not coped with emotional stress very well; eating does not help the situation and I know all that. Have joined a gym (not because I love it) and am doing yoga as well(I find it so peaceful... and destressing). Am hoping that hubby can lose a few lbs. as well. take care X Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2008 09:37PM ducky1 wrote: Hi Barb; Work has been keeping me busy but I wanted to check in ;) I am also taking Tamoxifen and have not experienced big side effects. Sounds like you need to go back to your healthy eating as at least you can control that portion of your life :) Last night we went to friends for a BD supper and it was great!! I feel good at 50! Church has become an emotional place (good emotional) as I am forever grateful that I feel good and am over the worst! They also played a few of my fav. songs so that always brings tears to my eyes. Barb, even though I am Catholic, I have no problem with yoga as I am only there to embrace the peace that comes through the exercise. Basically, I'm open to anything that helps take away any tension that I am feeling.   I know you have your meeting with the onc. Friday so I am anxious to hear what he says. Hopefully it will be a more informative meeting than with your other doc!! Do you like to cook?? I really do it for the family and not because I enjoy it.  My sister and mom are the cooks in the family; it skipped right over me That's ok though.. no one is any worse off!! take care my friend! Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2007 08:22AM ducky1 wrote: I met a gal in my support group who did not have cancer but was positive for the cancer gene so she decided to be proactive and had both breasts removed as well as a hystorectomy as she did not want to take any chances. Odds of her having cancer by a certain age were 100%. I honestly don<t know what I would do if it were me...
Posts.Title: OK Girls - I Want Your Honest Opinion skbennett jz20022001

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2007 01:28PM ducky1 wrote:
Posts.Title: Got Weight Gain??? Traci-----TripNeg figsgirls

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2007 03:22AM ducky1 wrote: Barbara, I have been following this thread and want to put in my 2 cents now :) Unlike you, I did get upset at my diagnosis but not when they actually told me. I am pretty good at "burying" worry but it has a strange way of surfacing when you least expect it. You mentioned that you want to be a volunteer for ladies like us. I do too but I will be honest, I know that it is too soon for me right now. I have just finished my battle... lump., chemo, rads, Tamoxifen and now am trying to get myself physically and mentally "well". For me, the physical aspect of this "war" has been easier than the "mental" part. I do support a gal that I met during this ordeal as she is having a rougher time than I. Your journey is just beginning so give yourself time. As for chemo, it is doable!! not always pleasant but you will get through it!  I, too, am a person of faith but I am also a realist and when they told me that my hair would fall out, I was prepared. I prayed a lot during this time and always tried to leave it in His hands and not ask for anything specific except courage to continue the journey... He always came through when I was at my weakest. Let us know what the test results are.  Hugs, Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 10:40AM ducky1 wrote: Barbara, When do you meet with the onc.?? You will feel even more relief once tx starts as they are finally "taking care of business" Carpe dium
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 10:21PM ducky1 wrote: Barb, You are not ignorant; it's better to ask than not to...it is latin for "Seize the day" which has pretty much always been what I believe in. My dad died of lung cancer when he was 57; actually, it is not the removal of the lung that killed him but a subsequent infection. That has greatly affected how I view life... do it NOW before you are 10ft under! You know the story where the couple finally retires and one dies and they had lots of plans... that was my parents but it's not going to be me. I have done a lot of traveling in my life and our kids' first trip out of North A. was on our 10th wedding anniversary and it hasn't stopped since. I want to squeeze every single bit of juice out of that orange...ok, that was really long winded but that's what it means I am very glad that you have an appt. for the onc. I know that you mentioned having a child... son, daughter? both? how old? take care my friend Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2007 11:25AM ducky1 wrote: Wow, you have a real menagerie of dogs Good on you!! My neighbor has a Lab and a mix and wants a puppy for xmas... she just LOVES dogs! The 2 wks. will actually fly by... keep yourself busy! Actually, the worst anxiety is over (or at least it was for me)... now it is just a matter of them telling you how many txs you will have and what your cocktail of choice will be. There are so many options out there. You said that you have 2 lumps; where are they located? You may not need rads. if they are not close to your chest wall!! and if you have a masectomy!! That said, rads. were much easier than other txs. I am off to paint...again Have a great wkd. Cathy
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2007 03:58PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; You know what is scary... eventually, all this mumbo jumbo will make sense to you... had coffee with one of my retired colleagues who talked about her hb<s bad health and they were checking out his heart... beats per min...I chimed in <oh, you mean a Muga scan>...guess the info we gather can be used in the real world as well. X Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2008 05:59PM ducky1 wrote: Hey Barb; Just quickly wanted to touch base with you...you sound GREAT!!! Hope you are not in too much pain. I thought of you on your surgery day and sent good vibes your way Did they definately say that you are having chemo and rads. cause sometimes gals who have masectomies don't need rads... wouldn't that be great!  Our trip was a healing one... I rarely thought of the C word... just enjoyed my family and life in general. I could live in Maui in a heartbeat... sigh! Now I am back at work half time and that is demanding but rewarding! take care will check in soon! xCath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 07:01PM ducky1 wrote: Oh my friend... can I wring that asshole doctor's neck?? That just pisses me off! You have every right to change oncs. esp. with one you are unsatisfied with!!! Holy crow!! Your hb was totally right!! You are in the "limbo" period before chemo when everything seems to keep us up!!! Hold on to that fighting spirit, my friend! You will see the other side of this...Deep breath...ok! Lymph nodes... 5 out 11 is not the end of the world. They have wonderful chemo that will eradicate those vilains. If your drain site has not totally healed, I would seriously question having chemo as your immune system will be compromised afterwards. A few questions.. what chemo are they giving you? Are you having Neulasta injections? Is chemo every 3 wks.? You say that you don't know what grade and stage you are; this would be useful info for you to have. My onc. shared all this with me. Did you have anyone with you when you met the onc?? If not, please bring someone with you when you meet the new guy. I had a tape recorder with me so all the info that escaped my pea sized brain is on there!! You are NOT being stupid about this. It is your LIFE that they are playing with and you have a right to some answers...NOW!! Can you tell I am pissed!! Ok...if I could fly down, I would!!! I am sending you a big hug! Do not have the chemo if you are not healed... please! I will check in tomorrow night! Love ya Cath
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2008 04:25PM ducky1 wrote: Barb; You do have to be careful about your immune system esp. if you are not having Neulasta shots (like me). My white count would plummet and take 4 wks. to get back up there. I was vigilant about hand washing and even had one of those little containers of hand cleanser in my purse. I didn't touch taps, door handles in the hospital... stayed away from sick people. If you get a fever (yup, even 100!!), you should call the emergency # right away (if you have one... there was always a nurse on call at our hospital. I never had to call!) I did call about mouth sores and they would contact the doc and get a presc. my way. As for food, I ate whatever I wanted...just wash the veggies and fruit! I was never hungry the first wk. as I didn't feel that great but everyone is diff. :) Cath
